meanings.definition: An unexpected gain or piece of good fortune.
meanings.sent1: Winning the lottery was a windfall for the lucky couple.
meanings.sent2: Receiving a bonus at work can be a windfall for many employees.
meanings.sent3: Finding money in an old jacket was a windfall for Sarah.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected inheritance was a windfall that changed their lives.
meanings.sent5: The sudden promotion was a windfall that brought joy to the team.

meanings.definition: A fruit or tree that has been blown down by the wind.
meanings.sent1: The windfalls from the apple tree were gathered to make pies.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, we found many windfalls in the orchard.
meanings.sent3: The windfall apples made for a delicious apple crisp.
meanings.sent4: The windfall pears lay scattered on the ground after the gusty wind.
meanings.sent5: The farmer collected the windfalls to feed them to the pigs.
